workflow.name: Automate blog-to-social media with GPT-4 for LinkedIn, X, and Reddit
workflow.description:
Turn your blog into a set-and-forget content engine: every new article is instantly repurposed into channel-specific social posts with visuals, keeping your brand visible on LinkedIn, X, and Reddit without extra copywriting time. Perfect for lean marketing teams who want consistent, always-on distribution from a single source of content.

# How it works
‚Ä¢ Watches your blog RSS feed (or receives a single URL) and detects new articles.
‚Ä¢ Saves each post in Postgres so every article is only processed once.
‚Ä¢ Fetches the article HTML, extracts the main body content and sends it to OpenAI (GPT-4.1).
‚Ä¢ OpenAI creates platform-optimized copy: 1 LinkedIn post, 1 X/Twitter post, 1 Reddit post + image prompts.
‚Ä¢ Generates on-brand images with OpenAI and publishes everything automatically to LinkedIn, X, and Reddit.
‚Ä¢ You can also trigger it manually or via webhook whenever you want to push a specific campaign.

![image1.png](fileId:3287)
![image2.png](fileId:3288)


# Setup Steps
‚Ä¢ Time: around 20‚Äì40 minutes for someone familiar with n8n and the platforms.
‚Ä¢ Create a Postgres table ‚Äúrss_items‚Äù with fields: guid (PRIMARY KEY), title, link, published_at.
‚Ä¢ Add credentials in n8n for:
  ‚Äì Postgres
  ‚Äì OpenAI
  ‚Äì LinkedIn OAuth2
  ‚Äì X/Twitter OAuth2 + OAuth1 (for media upload)
  ‚Äì Reddit OAuth2
‚Ä¢ In the RSS node, set your blog feed URL (for example: https://yourblog.com/feed).
‚Ä¢ In the webhook node, confirm the URL/path you want external tools or other workflows to call with a ‚Äúlink‚Äù field.
‚Ä¢ Run the manual trigger with one test blog URL to verify:
  ‚Äì Article content is extracted correctly.
  ‚Äì AI returns LinkedIn/X/Reddit posts and image prompts.
  ‚Äì Posts and images appear correctly on all social accounts.
‚Ä¢ Once tests look good, enable the Schedule Trigger so Blog2Social AI runs automatically at your chosen interval.

parameters.query:
INSERT INTO rss_items (guid, title, link, published_at)
VALUES ('{{ $json.guid }}', '{{ $json.title }}','{{ $json.link }}', '{{ $json.pubDate }}')
ON CONFLICT (guid) DO NOTHING
RETURNING link;

parameters.content:
## What this workflow does

This workflow auto-turns my blog posts into a multi-channel social campaign:

- Source: WordPress RSS feed or a single URL.
- Dedupes posts via Postgres so each article is processed only once.
- Fetches the article HTML, extracts content, and sends it to OpenAI.
- OpenAI returns:
  - Title + short description
  - 1 LinkedIn post
  - 1 X/Twitter post
  - 1 Reddit post
  - Image prompts for LinkedIn + X
- Posts to:
  - LinkedIn (article share with image)
  - X (tweet with uploaded image)
  - Reddit (text post)
- Returns all results as JSON to the webhook caller (for logs/monitoring).

Use cases:
- Fully automated RSS ‚Üí Social
- Manual ‚Äútest one URL‚Äù
- External apps calling the webhook with a link field.

## Prerequisites & Setup

Credentials needed:

- OpenAI ‚Äì for text + image generation (Message a model, Generate Image for X, Generate an image for LinkedIn).
- Postgres ‚Äì for RSS deduplication.
- LinkedIn OAuth2 ‚Äì for the ‚ÄúCreate a post‚Äù node.
- X/Twitter OAuth2 + OAuth1 ‚Äì for tweet + media upload (Twitter Post Media, Create Tweet).
- Reddit OAuth2 ‚Äì for Create a post1.

Postgres table (schema):

CREATE TABLE rss_items (
  guid TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
  title TEXT,
  link TEXT,
  published_at TEXT
);

- guid must be unique so ON CONFLICT (guid) DO NOTHING works correctly.

Blog & endpoints:

- RSS feed URL set in RSS Read:
  [RSS Feds URL]
- Webhook path used by Pass URL and internal HTTP nodes:
  [Pass URL Webhook]

Model & limits:

- Message a model uses gpt-4.1 with JSON output.
- Image nodes use the OpenAI image API.
- Make sure:
  - API key is valid
  - Sufficient quota / rate limits
  - Response respects the JSON schema (title, description, posts, image prompts).

## How to run & test

Manual test mode:

1. Open the workflow in n8n.
2. In Edit Fields, set link to a specific blog post URL.
3. Execute starting from When clicking ‚ÄòExecute workflow‚Äô.
4. Confirm:
   - Article is fetched and parsed.
   - OpenAI returns the correct JSON.
   - Posts appear on LinkedIn/X/Reddit.
   - Execution data shows responses from each social node.

Scheduled RSS mode:

1. Ensure the Postgres table exists and credentials work.
2. In Schedule Trigger, set your desired interval (e.g., every hour).
3. Enable the workflow.
4. The flow will:
   - Poll RSS
   - Insert new items into Postgres
   - For new posts, call the webhook branch to generate and publish content.

Webhook mode (external caller):

1. Use the Pass URL endpoint:
   - Method: POST
   - Path: /webhook/[webhook url]
2. Send a request with link (this workflow currently uses multipart form-data for body parameters).
3. Workflow will:
   - Fetch article
   - Generate platform-specific posts + images
   - Publish to LinkedIn, X, Reddit
   - Return merged JSON via Respond to Webhook.

Debug tips:

- If no posts are created:
  - Check Message a model output shape (must match JSON structure).
  - Verify link traverses: Webhook ‚Üí Set Link ‚Üí HTTP Request ‚Üí HTML ‚Üí Message a model.
- If RSS items are skipped:
  - Inspect SQL node output:
    - If RETURNING link is empty, the item already exists.
  - Confirm guid uniqueness in the table.
- If social posting fails:
  - Re-check OAuth credentials and token scopes.
  - For X:
    - Make sure media upload returns a valid media_id.
  - For LinkedIn:
    - Ensure person URN is correct.
  - For Reddit:
    - Verify subreddit / user posting permissions.

## When clicking ‚ÄòExecute workflow‚Äô
**Purpose:** Manual test entry.  
**Why:** Lets you verify end-to-end without waiting for RSS/schedules.  
**What to check:** After run, the `Edit Fields` node must set a valid `link`.

## Edit Fields
**Purpose:** Inject a test `link` value.  
**Why:** Guarantees downstream nodes always have a URL during manual tests.  
**Tip:** Swap the hard-coded URL before each test to avoid re-posting the same article.

## Post Social Manual (HTTP Request)
**Purpose:** Calls the internal webhook with the test `link`.  
**Why:** Reuses the exact same posting path as RSS/webhook to keep logic DRY.  
**I/O:** Sends `link` (multipart form-data) ‚Üí triggers the ‚ÄúPass URL‚Äù branch.

## Pass URL (Webhook)
**Purpose:** External + internal entry point to post a single article.  
**Why:** Decouples ingestion from posting so other tools/workflows can trigger it.  
**I/O:** Expects body param `link`. Responds via ‚ÄúRespond to Webhook‚Äù at the end.

## Set Link
**Purpose:** Normalize incoming data to a `link` field.  
**Why:** Ensures downstream nodes reference one consistent property.  
**Tip:** If you change the param name in callers, update this node mapping.

## HTTP Request
**Purpose:** Fetch the article HTML from `{{$json.link}}`.  
**Why:** Reliable source content beats scraping fragments from RSS.  
**Failure tips:** 4xx/5xx? Check URL, robots, or add headers (user-agent).

## HTML
**Purpose:** Extract clean text (`content`) from `<body>`.  
**Why:** LLMs perform better on de-noised, trimmed input.  
**Tip:** Adjust selector or cleanup if your site uses heavy wrappers.

## Message a model
**Purpose:** Turn article into platform-specific posts + image prompts (JSON).  
**Why:** Single LLM call keeps speed + consistency across channels.  
**Guardrails:** Enforce JSON output; handle ‚ÄúContent fetch failed‚Äù fallback.

## Wait
**Purpose:** Small delay before image/Twitter media steps.  
**Why:** Helps avoid rate bursts and sequencing issues.  
**Tip:** Reduce if your account limits are generous.

## Generate Image for X
**Purpose:** Create X/Twitter image from the model‚Äôs `image_prompt`.  
**Why:** Visuals lift engagement and CTR on social feeds.  
**Output:** Binary `data` used by `Twitter Post Media`.

## Twitter Post Media
**Purpose:** Upload the generated image to X; returns `media_id`.  
**Why:** X requires a media upload step before tweeting.  
**Failure tips:** Ensure OAuth1 is configured and file size limits are respected.

## Create Tweet
**Purpose:** Publish the tweet with text + `media_id`.  
**Why:** Completes the X workflow with visual content.  
**Tip:** If attachments fail, inspect the previous node‚Äôs full response.

## Wait 5s
**Purpose:** Small delay before LinkedIn image generation.  
**Why:** Staggers API calls to reduce throttling.  
**Note:** Tune based on your OpenAI + LinkedIn rate limits.

## Generate an image for LinkedIn
**Purpose:** Create LinkedIn thumbnail from its `image_prompt`.  
**Why:** Rich preview increases dwell time and clicks.  
**Output:** Binary `data` consumed by LinkedIn post.

## Create a post (LinkedIn)
**Purpose:** Publish LinkedIn post with text, title, description, link, and thumbnail.  
**Why:** Drives professional audience back to the article.  
**Tip:** Verify `person` URN and visibility; failures often come from auth scope.

## Post Reddit (Reddit)
**Purpose:** Submit the Reddit text post (user profile via `u_leeseifer`).  
**Why:** Tap into communities for discussion-driven reach.  
**Tip:** If posting to a subreddit later, ensure rules/permissions first.

## Merge Results For Response
**Purpose:** Consolidate results from X, LinkedIn, and Reddit.  
**Why:** Single combined payload simplifies logging + responses.  
**Tip:** If something is missing here, inspect the earlier branch outputs.

## Respond to Webhook
**Purpose:** Return merged results to the original webhook caller.  
**Why:** Provides a consistent, machine-readable completion summary.  
**Tip:** Great place to capture for monitoring/alerts dashboards.

## Pass URL (Webhook)
**Purpose:** External + internal entry point to post a single article.  
**Why:** Decouples ingestion from posting so other tools/workflows can trigger it.  
**I/O:** Expects body param `link`. Responds via ‚ÄúRespond to Webhook‚Äù at the end.

## RSS Read
**Purpose:** Pull recent items from your blog feed.  
**Why:** Standard, low-friction way to detect new articles.  
**Output:** Items with `guid`, `title`, `link`, `pubDate` for dedupe.

## Execute a SQL query (Postgres)
**Purpose:** Insert new RSS items and return `link` for only the new ones.  
**Why:** `ON CONFLICT (guid) DO NOTHING` guarantees one-time posting.  
**Schema:** `guid PRIMARY KEY, title, link, published_at`.

## If
**Purpose:** Route only items where the SQL `RETURNING link` indicates ‚Äúnew‚Äù.  
**Why:** Prevents duplicates from reaching the posting branch.  
**Tip:** If all items skip, check table keys and `guid` consistency.

## Loop Over Items (Split In Batches)
**Purpose:** Process new items in manageable batches.  
**Why:** Controls throughput and avoids API spikes.  
**Tip:** Adjust batch size/interval for your posting cadence.

## Call Post Social (HTTP Request)
**Purpose:** For each new RSS item, invoke the same webhook posting path.  
**Why:** Reuse logic; keep RSS and manual/webhook paths identical.  
**I/O:** Sends `link` ‚Üí flows back into ‚ÄúPass URL‚Äù.

user.name: Le Nguyen
user.bio: Salesforce Architect with 10+ years of experience in CRM, integrations, and automation. Skilled in Apex, LWC, REST APIs, and full-stack dev (JavaScript, .NET). I build secure, scalable workflows in n8n‚Äîconnecting Salesforce, Stripe, and more. Passionate about lead scoring, data sync, and secure field masking. Certified Application Architect with deep expertise in platform, integration, and data architecture.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
